title: France Balance of Trade
description: France recorded a trade deficit of 17486.70 EUR Million in September of 2022. Balance of Trade in France averaged -1676.52 EUR Million from 1970 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 2674 EUR Million in October of 1997 and a record low of -17486.70 EUR Million in September of 2022. Since 2004, France has been recording trade deficits due the gradual erosion of the export-oriented industry, the appreciation of the euro and the increasing dependency on imports of energy and manufactured products. In 2017, the biggest trade deficits were recorded with: China & Hong Kong, Germany, the Netherlands, Italy and Belgium; while the biggest trade surpluses were recorded with: the Middle East, the UK, Africa and Switzerland. This page provides the latest reported value for - France Balance of Trade - plus previous releases, historical high and low, short-term forecast and long-term prediction, economic calendar, survey consensus and news.
author: Ministère de l'Économie et des Finances
